reviews.text: Location of the Golden Landmark hotel is excellent. It is near the shopping area for great bargains and the MRT is 2 blocks from the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and nice. What I got was the deluxe room and was really nice with big beds too. It was a real value for money. The hotel staff was helpful most specially the bellhop who help us when we had to store our luggage after we had checked out. They also helped us call a taxi for the airport. If you have time, the hotel also gives a free Heritage Tour via the hop on hop off bus for hotel guests, 2 persons per room FREE! I will always recommend the hotel to my friends, maybe their other properties in Singapore are just as good.
reviews.title: Golden Landmark in Singapore

reviews.text: We were arriving at the airport around midnight and were in need of a place to stay, so we made a booking right at the airport hotel agency. We chose Golden Landmark because it seemed to be the best value hotel which turned out to be a big mistake. Once appeared there, we were briefed that we have to pay for the extra bed which we had not been told when booking and moreover 10 Euros accessorily because we booked at the airport. We got informed that we would get breakfast until 10:00h (actually it was until 10:30h) but the Receptionist didn’t mention that we will be charged for that seperately. When they presented the invoice we suddenly got aware that it was even worse: we had to pay tax in addition which - again – hadn’t been indicated before, and even cleaning the room was stated accounts in addition. It's not that we mind paying for services but we do mind if we get constantly surprised by things to pay that we hadn't been acquainted beforehand.
reviews.title: rip-off

reviews.text: I stayed with my family at this hotel from 17th to 20th of Oct 2008. I was looking for a hotel which had spacious rooms and close to MRT and city centre. I found Golden Landmark to be ideally located in central Singapore and close to Bugis MRT. It was walking distance from Little India, which helped us having affordable Indian food. (The Indian restaurant in the hotel was costly) The rooms were spacious and bathroom clean. The swimming pool on the fifth floor was neat. The hotel staff was quite helpful and all the talks from checkin to check out were carried out smoothly, without any worries. The best part was the travel desk managed by a private travel company called Luxury Tours. The lady was very helpful in planning our sightseeing.
reviews.title: What you pay for, you get!!

likes.disliked: — Just a little tired, not modern

reviews.text: Overall a very good value for money hotel by Singapore standards.

reviews.text: In Singapore we stayed in The Golden Landmark Hotel (a Far East Hotel) which was on 390 Victoria Street, It seemed to be in the Arab area of town and was just 5 minutes walk from the MRT station - It\s a big place with a nice open air pool, the staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are probably a small step above the most basic.
